title.narrative: Central African Republic Joint Response, Phase 3

description.narrative: FSL activities (incl. mainstreamed protection) target vulnerable HHs that have arrived in/ returned to Ouham Pende during the last 3 months and that have limited livelihoods options as most assets were lost when fleeing their homes. Other targeted vulnerable HHs are female- and child-headed HH, pregnant or lactating women, people with disabilities, people with HIV, elderly people and those hosting orphans. Child Protection activities target vulnerable children that are affected by the fragile context in CAR. Many have lost one/both of their parents and are now head of the HH and taking care of siblings. Host families who take in UASC are often already poor, so that HH vulnerability increases when hosting these children.

The CARJR3 has two Strategic Objectives (SO1 and SO2): Objective 1: To alleviate human suffering of the population of the Central African Republic through the effective and efficient implementation of humanitarian response activities by the Dutch NGOs. Objective 2: To generate value through the collaboration between the CARJR3 members and other stakeholders.

World Vision contributes to the following objectives: Protection, Objective 2: Conflict affected populations have access to protection according to fundamental Human Rights (inclusive of GBV and Children's rights) as well as to effective prevention mechanisms upholding their security and dignity Protection, Objective 3: Reinforce the protection mechanisms at community level as well as access to basic services Food Security & Livelihoods, Objective 1: Safe lives and contribute to the economic autonomy of the population
Indirect Cost Recovery of World Vision Netherlands

title.narrative: FSL.SO1: Safe lives and contribute to the economic autonomy of the population
# people benefiting from emergency food supplies

description.narrative: 4,800 vulnerable individuals receive a four-month food ration

comment.narrative: The main activity has been the distribution of food rations to 1,600 IDP households during two months, reaching 8,603 household members (1286 men, 1434 women, 2344 boys and 3539 girls).

title.narrative: # people (male, female) benefit from activities to reinforce their livelihoods

description.narrative: 80 people receive agricultural training as preparation for the next agricultural season

title.narrative: # people (male, female) benefit from activities to reinforce their livelihoods

description.narrative: 800 vulnerable HHs receive on-site agricultural training and guidance as preparation for the next agricultural season

title.narrative: # of HH, mentioning sex of hh lead, has benefited of seeds and tools

description.narrative: 800 vulnerable HHs receive seeds and agricultural tools as preparation for the next agricultural season

title.narrative: P.SO3: Reinforce the protection mechanisms at community level as well as access to basic services
# children < 18 (boys and girls) benefit from psychosocial and life skills support within Child Friendly Spaces / Childrens clubs

description.narrative: Creation and rehabilitation of 10 Child Friendly Spaces for provision of psychosocial support, play ground spaces and learning opportunities

comment.narrative: A total of 3 Child Friendly Spaces (CFS) have been constructed: 2 in Bossembele and 1 in Bocaranga. A total of 10 CFS have been rehabilitated in Yaloké. An average number of 1,914 children (887 girls and 1027 boys) participate in CFS activities three days a week (from Friday to Sunday).

title.narrative: # community networks, composed of at least 25% females and 25% girls, are active in sensitization activities, in referral systems and early warning systems, under the leadership of their mayors

description.narrative: Establishment and training of Community Child Protection (CCP) committees to carry out sensitizations on (child) protection issues during voucher distributions and public meetings.

comment.narrative: Through the sensitization activities of these trained CCP, the project targets to train 100 people and reach 10,000 people.
90 people have been trained. A total of 21,157 people have been reached through the sensitization activities.

title.narrative: # community networks, composed of at least 25% females and 25% girls, are active in sensitization activities, in referral systems and early warning systems, under the leadership of their mayors

description.narrative: Establishment of 5 referral mechanisms and training of people involved in the mechanism

comment.narrative: Through this activity, 100 people involved in the mechanism will be trained. Also, 2000 children will be helped through the referral mechanisms.
90 people have been trained. A total of 841 children have been assisted through the referral mechanisms.

title.narrative: P.SO2: Conflict affected populations have access to protection according to fundamental Human Rights (inclusive of GBV and Children's rights) as well as to effective prevention mechanisms upholding their security and dignity
# of unaccompanied children (#boys, # girls) are cared for in families or reunited with their biological families

description.narrative: Strengthening the network of 35 host families for the reunification of unaccompanied and separated children, including training of the heads of these HHs; and, Unaccompanied and separated children supported and hosted by host families to wait for reunification with biological families

comment.narrative: 39 host families have been identified and trained so that they could support 43 unaccompanied children.
